abstract: The frequency of acute exacerbations (AECOPD) is a critical predictor of disease progression in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). However, the dynamics of the lower respiratory microbiome across a spectrum of exacerbation frequency remain poorly characterized, limiting insights into microbial drivers of susceptibility.
